abstract: - to determine role cytokine-like protein dkk3 (dikkopf-3) directly transdifferentiating fibroblasts endothelial cells (ecs) and underlying mechanisms. approach and results- dkk3 overexpression human fibroblasts defined conditions 4 days led notable change cell morphology and progenitor gene expression. it revealed cells went mesenchymal-to-epithelial transition and subsequently expressed kdr (vascular endothelial growth factor receptor 2) high levels. further culture ec defined media led differentiation progenitors functional ecs capable angiogenesis vitro and vivo, regulated vegf (vascular endothelial growth factor)/mir (microrna)-125a-5p/stat3 (signal transducer and activator transcription factor 3) axis. more importantly, fibroblast-derived ecs showed ability form patent endothelium-like monolayer tissue-engineered vascular grafts ex vivo. conclusions- these data demonstrate dkk3 capable directly differentiating human fibroblasts functional ecs defined media and provides novel potential strategy endothelial regeneration.
genes: signal transducer and activator transcription factor 3
signal transducer and activator transcription factor 3

abstract: mesenchymal stem cells reportedly marked effect tumor growth suppression. however, remains uncertain whether adipose‑derived mesenchymal stem cells (adscs) grafted fat contribute breast cancer growth and recurrence. in present study, interactions adscs and mcf‑7 breast cancer cells evaluated matrigel co‑culture system and vivo nude mouse model. results suggested mcf‑7 cells exerted tumor tropism effects adscs and may regulated chemokines, macrophage inflammatory protein (mip)‑1δ and mip‑3α. additionally, adscs significantly induced tumorsphere formation vitro and promoted tumorigenicity vivo. rt‑qpcr analysis indicated tumorsphere formation mcf‑7 cells associated induction stem‑like properties, mediated epithelial‑-mesenchymal transition. together, present findings indicated adscs exhibit tropism and induce tumorsphere formation mcf‑7 cells.
